TextBody:
Hello,

Thank you for reaching out to us.
You can block USB devices from the Device Control menu, and you have the possibility to block it globally(from Global Rights) or more granularly (Groups, Computer/Users, or devices). 
I will attach the user manual link below, where you can find more informations regarding how you can configure rights:

https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/EndpointProtector_5.9.4/page/Content/EndpointProtector/Admin/DeviceControl/GlobalRights.htm

Please let me know if you managed to block the USB device after that and if we can close this ticket.

Have a nice day,
Best regards,
Alin Anca

Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix - DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
CoSoSys Ltd www.endpointprotector.com
ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0OGik1:ref
Subject: Deploy USB blocking policy    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0OGik1:ref ]

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000OGik1:ref

Ok, I understand that in Device Control/Global Rights I can block all USB
devices.

And then, below, I will be able to add an exception for a specific device.

 

But, why in the Device Control/Devices I don't see all the devices, only
200? I send you the list in excel, I don't see USB Storage Device, the last
ones are Serial Port, it is as if there was a limitation.

 

I can see USB in the logs.

 

 

De: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>

Para: buzonsti@gdaservicios.es
